required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study is in line with the German educational plan with the aim to implement a tool to increase and monitor the awareness of tuberculosis screening and to reinforce the patient eligibility for a treatment with Remicade according to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPc).

detailed_description.textblock: This study population was chosen from a non-probability sample.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had the Mendel Mantoux Test as the First Screening Test for Active or Latent Tuberculosis (TB) Before Starting Treatment
primary_outcome.description: In order to increase the attending physician's awareness of the required tuberculosis screening and to support the screening itself, tuberculosis screening was performed and documented before treatment administration (baseline). The number of participants who had the Mendel Mantoux test (tuberculin sensitivity skin test by intradermal injection) as the first screening test was presented in three categories: Yes Missing (represents no entry, but may mean another test was performed as first screening test and documented)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had the Tine Test as the First Screening Test for Active or Latent Tuberculosis Before Starting Treatment
primary_outcome.description: In order to increase the attending physician's awareness of the required tuberculosis screening and to support the screening itself, tuberculosis screening was performed and documented before treatment administration (baseline). The number of participants who had the Tine test (multiple puncture tuberculin skin test) as the first screening test was presented in three categories: Yes Missing (represents no entry, but may mean another test was performed as first screening test and documented)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had the In-vitro TB Test as the First Screening Test for Active or Latent Tuberculosis Before Starting
primary_outcome.description: In order to increase the attending physician's awareness of the required tuberculosis screening and to support the screening itself, tuberculosis screening was performed and documented before treatment administration (baseline). The number of participants who had the in-vitro TB test (cellular blood test, i.e. gamma interferon release assays) as the first screening test was presented in three categories: Yes Missing (represents no entry, but may mean another test was performed as first screening test and documented)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had a Chest X-ray as Part of TB Screening for Active or Latent Tuberculosis Before Starting Treatment
primary_outcome.description: In order to increase the attending physician's awareness of the required tuberculosis screening and to support the screening itself, tuberculosis screening was performed and documented before treatment administration (baseline). If done according to guidelines, complete TB screening comprised a TB screening test and a chest X-ray. The number of participants who had a frontal chest X-ray was presented in three categories: Yes Missing

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Disease Activity by Means of the Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index (BASDAI) at the Time of Enrollment and at the First Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and time of first infusion
secondary_outcome.description: The BASDAI score was calculated based on the responses to questions 1-6, with each component rated on a scale of 0 (best) to 10 (worst) based on the severity of various characteristics. A decrease in BASDAI over time indicated improvement in disease activity. The score corresponded to the sum of the point values from questions 1-4 and the mean of the point values from questions 5 and 6, subsequently divided by five. BASDAI was calculated at the time of enrollment (baseline) and at the time of first infusion.

arm_group.description: Subjects with ankylosing spondylitis who were treated with infliximab. The dosage and infusion intervals were employed in accordance to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

intervention.description: Dosage and infusion intervals were employed in accordance to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with ankylosing spondylitis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- As per Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were those with Ankylosing spondylitis (AS) starting treatment with Remicade at 26 sites in Germany from Jul 2003 through Dec 2010

group.title: Infliximab
group.description: Subjects with ankylosing spondylitis who were treated with infliximab. The dosage and infusion intervals were employed in accordance to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

participants_list.participants: Includes 78 participants whose completer/non-completer status was not reported (missing)

group.title: Infliximab
group.description: Subjects with ankylosing spondylitis who were treated with infliximab. The dosage and infusion intervals were employed in accordance to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Had the Mendel Mantoux Test as the First Screening Test for Active or Latent Tuberculosis (TB) Before Starting Treatment
outcome.description: In order to increase the attending physician's awareness of the required tuberculosis screening and to support the screening itself, tuberculosis screening was performed and documented before treatment administration (baseline). The number of participants who had the Mendel Mantoux test (tuberculin sensitivity skin test by intradermal injection) as the first screening test was presented in three categories: Yes Missing (represents no entry, but may mean another test was performed as first screening test and documented)
outcome.population: Data was analyzed for all AS patients whose data was entered into the database and finalized by signature of the physician.

outcome.title: Assessment of Disease Activity by Means of the Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index (BASDAI) at the Time of Enrollment and at the First Infusion
outcome.description: The BASDAI score was calculated based on the responses to questions 1-6, with each component rated on a scale of 0 (best) to 10 (worst) based on the severity of various characteristics. A decrease in BASDAI over time indicated improvement in disease activity. The score corresponded to the sum of the point values from questions 1-4 and the mean of the point values from questions 5 and 6, subsequently divided by five. BASDAI was calculated at the time of enrollment (baseline) and at the time of first infusion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Trial results belong to the SPONSOR only, all investigators are not allowed to publish trial results without permission of the SPONSOR.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
